intro: Barbarea palustris, commonly known as marsh cress, is a flowering plant native to moist and wet habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stem is often reddish and branched. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Barbarea palustris is known for its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and is often found in marshes, stream banks, and damp meadows.
